newsitem.title: USA: U.S. bulk millfeeds - Prices mostly steady.
newsitem.headline: U.S. bulk millfeeds - Prices mostly steady.

text.p: Millfeed prices were mostly steady Friday amid featureless activity, millfeed dealers said.

"The market has no direction of its own," a Missouri dealer said. "I have been told that a lot of competing ingredients havebeen dropping in prices like soy hulls, brewers' grains and that kind of stuff."
On the other side of the coin, flour mills were still not running well. "It is a very thin market," he said.

In Minneapolis, prices were steady, bolstered by tight supplies. "There is not much feed left to trade this week," a Minneapolis broker said. "Some flour mills are down because of the rain, snow and flood problems in North Dakota and Minnesota."

Runtimes were also short in the Tennessee area. "The market is slowly drifting downward and the reason is that it has been so slow in coming down is that runtimes have been so poor," a Chattanooga dealer said.
He noted runtimes have been averaging about five days a week and some mills were down due to fumigation, he said.
